pullRequest.title: Change Uyuni testing docker images to Leap 15.2
pullRequest.bodyText:
What does this PR change?
Change Uyuni testing docker images to Leap 15.2
I built the images locally. Didn't see any errors.
GUI diff
No difference. Testing stuff.

 DONE

Documentation


No documentation needed: Testing stuff.


 DONE


Test coverage


No tests: We are actually changing tests


 DONE


Links
Related: SUSE/spacewalk#11749

 DONE

Changelogs
If you don't need a changelog check, please mark this checkbox:

 No changelog needed

If you uncheck the checkbox after the PR is created, you will need to re-run changelog_test (see below)
Re-run a test
If you need to re-run a test, please mark the related checkbox, it will be unchecked automatically once it has re-run:

 Re-run test "changelog_test"
 Re-run test "backend_unittests_pgsql"
 Re-run test "java_lint_checkstyle"
 Re-run test "java_pgsql_tests"
 Re-run test "schema_migration_test_oracle"
 Re-run test "schema_migration_test_pgsql"
 Re-run test "susemanager_unittests"
 Re-run test "javascript_lint"
 Re-run test "spacecmd_unittests"

commit.message: Fix suseChannelUserRoleView to use notGloballySubscribableChannels as the in the initial setup

nodes.bodyText: This comes from the original script, but I wonder... do we need it if we have the CREATE OR REPLACE below :-?
nodes.diffHunk:
@@ -0,0 +1,82 @@
+-- Copyright (c) 2020 SUSE LLC

+
+DROP VIEW IF EXISTS suseChannelUserRoleView;

commit.message: The change for the table virtual name itself was missing

nodes.bodyText: I basically ran: sed -i -e 's/notGlobSubsChannels/notGloballySubscribableChannels/g' * Rest of the file is the same except the comments above (copyright updated, mention to oracle equivalent removed)
nodes.diffHunk:
@@ -0,0 +1,82 @@
+-- Copyright (c) 2020 SUSE LLC
+--
+-- This software is licensed to you under the GNU General Public License,
+-- version 2 (GPLv2). There is NO WARRANTY for this software, express or
+-- implied, including the implied warranties of MERCHANTABILITY or FITNESS
+-- FOR A PARTICULAR PURPOSE. You should have received a copy of GPLv2
+-- along with this software; if not, see
+-- http://www.gnu.org/licenses/old-licenses/gpl-2.0.txt.
+--
+
+DROP VIEW IF EXISTS suseChannelUserRoleView;
+
+CREATE OR REPLACE VIEW
+suseChannelUserRoleView
+AS
+  SELECT
+    combination.channel_id,
+    combination.user_id,
+    combination.role,
+    combination.user_org_id AS org_id,
+    combination.parent_channel_id,
+    CASE
+      -- if channel is in an org trusted by the user's org, and if the channel itself is shared between the two, then user can subscribe it
+      WHEN combination.role = 'subscribe' AND sharedChannels.is_shared_channel IS NOT NULL
+        THEN NULL
+      -- otherwise, if channel is not in user's org, then user can't manage it
+      WHEN combination.role = 'manage' AND combination.channel_org_id IS NULL OR combination.channel_org_id <> combination.user_org_id
+        THEN 'channel_not_owned'
+      -- otherwise, if channel is in a family without permissions for the user's org, then user can't subscribe it
+      WHEN combination.role = 'subscribe' AND channelPermissions.is_channel_available IS NULL
+        THEN 'channel_not_available'
+      -- otherwise, if channel is in a family without permissions for the user's org, then user can't subscribe it
+      WHEN adminUsers.is_admin_user IS NOT NULL
+        THEN NULL
+      -- otherwise, if channel does not have the "not_globally_subscribable" bit set, user can subscribe it
+      WHEN combination.role = 'subscribe' AND notGloballySubscribableChannels.is_not_globally_subscribable IS NULL

commit.message: drop function in the public schema and create it in rhn_entitlement
